Oh and for the rest of you, if peddler accepts, we will need some judges. Not sure how many and how we pick them. Anyone else here been involved in a proper debate here before know how that bit works?

 
 I suppose you need a specific theme to debate- the whole Evolution vs Creation is a nebulous subject with many tangents one could go off on. Also it is easier to name a winner if there is a specific issue being debated. This question/statement could then mark the start of the debate
 
 What material is each debator allowed to contribute- ie. do you allow copy pasting and links or does all material have to be in their own words?
 
 How long will the debate last? there needs to be a limit (say number of posts) that each party must observe. What about the structure? will each debator take it in turns to make a post which the other then responds to?
 
 How to pick a winner? best points made, good use of english, penalise "hedgehogs" (ie. those who stray off-topic), penalise waffling, good conduct in the debate (ie. no personal digs etc.).

How to pick a winner? best points made, good use of english, penalise "hedgehogs" (ie. those who stray off-topic), penalise waffling, good conduct in the debate (ie. no personal digs etc.).

Sounds like a caper to me, when you going to start Clive/peddler?

Right peddler and I have agreed a debate topic (see http://4forums.com/political/showpost.php?p=127823&postcount=219). The topic is to be the evolution of the feather. 
 
 I shall be arguing that the current majority view amongst paleontologists is that birds evolved from theropod dinosaurs but that others argue that a non dinosaur was the pre-avian bird ancestor. Further I shall argue that this disagreement comes about due to the large amount of evidence available that can be interpreted in different ways, rather than due to a lack of evidence.
 
 I invite peddler to express the opposite position from his own point of view and to indicate whether he would like to go first or not. Also I invite peddler to nominate another judge.

Version 2 of my post more in line with the forums rules on politeness:
 
 
Don't forget the butterfly post. Fair is fair and I asked you first.
In the interests of getting peddler to debate evolution with me in a formal fashion, I've decided that I will fully meet his requirements to facing me in a debate.
 
 So peddler, please specify what you require me to do to satisfy your "butterfly evolution" question:
 
 1. Explain why the pupal stage of a butterfly is not liquid?
 2. Explain why the pupal stage of a butterfly is not dead?
 3. Explain why the pupal stage of a butterfly is not jelly?
 4. Explain is very basic details the life cycle of the butterfly so that you might better understand the topic?
 5. Explain to you why having a growing stage and mating stage of a lifecycle that feed upon different food sources in beneficial without reference to population ecology equations?
 6. Explain to you why having a growing stage and mating stage of a lifecycle that feed upon different food sources in beneficial with reference to population ecology equations?
 7. Detail the hormonal processes that suppress the development of adult features in the laval stage?
 8. Discuss the appearance of various types of insect within the fossil record compared with the complexity of their metamorphosis?
 9. Discuss the various forms that the pupal stage takes within different types of butterfly and moth, from a near fully formed adult in a silk cocoon to the unprotected forms that appear very different to the adult stage.
 
 You are free to request any combination of the above nine options to form a reasonable answer and I shall address them in the appropriate thread. I'll then move on to do a similar exercise with the avian lung.

I don't get that. How can anyone hope to proselytize if they are not prepared to listen to the other person and answer their questions? 
 
 Peddler has clearly spent time reading a variety of evolution-bashing websites and, being convinced of the arguments himself, assumed he was equipped to bring a bunch of "evolutionists" to their senses. That fact that he was hopelessly out of his depth in such an endeavor is beside the point though. I'd expect someone proselytizing to mainly listen and answer questions, not to endlessly build up and knock down strawman whilst ignoring those he is trying to convert. One effect of peddler's long ignore list is to make creationists look like fools. He posts his straw men and they are debunked, but he doesn't see it because of his ignore list. Then he posts the same nonsense again and makes himself look either stupid or dishonest. It appears that he is unable to answer real question and unable to respond to real information about his assertions. For example, he continues to claim that caterpillars completely disolve into liquid although the truth has been posted many times. In this way, peddler makes himself the laughing stock of the very people he is trying to proselytize. Peddler puts forward the best arguments against his own assertions - he can't support them and when he realized that he has made himself look foolish, he puts the person who did so on the ignore list. Clearly he is in over his head.
